sect1.title: Output with Remarks, Metadata or Draft Watermark
sect1.para: &dapsacr; offers a number of features to simplify review and translation processes. For example, you can insert remark elements in the source code and generate an output format that either includes or suppresses these remarks. You can also generate preview versions of your documentation with a DRAFT watermark appearing on the HTML or PDF output.

note.title: Output with Remarks or Draft Watermark
note.para: The command options --draft option and --remarks are supported for HTML, HTML-single, PDF and &epub;, but not for all &dapsacr; output formats.

sect1.para: If you use &dm; in addition to &dapsacr;, you can flag your XML files with meta-information (like workflow status). &dapsacr; offers an option to also display this meta-information in the generated output.

varlistentry.term: Including Remark Elements in the Output

listitem.para: When generating PDFs with FOP, the contents of the remark elements is shown in italics within the text. XEP supports conversion of remark elements into PDF annotations. This feature is enabled in &dapsacr; by default, but if you want XEP to treat remark elements like FOP does, you can change the respective &dapsacr; parameter.taroth 2012-10-16: todo - add link as soon as this is covered in &dapsuser; In HTML, HTML-single and &epub; output, the contents of the remark elements is shown in red within the text.

varlistentry.term: Building PDFs with a DRAFT Watermark

listitem.para: Generates a PDF that has a DRAFT watermark printed on each page.

note.title: Draft Mode Implied
note.para: Using the --remarks and --meta options for generating output automatically turns draft mode on.

sect1.para: taroth 2013-01-07: also mention meta By default, &dapsacr; adds a string to the base name of the output file to flag output formats generated with special options. Example file names are daps-example_draft_en.pdf or daps-example_remarks_draft_en.pdf.
